item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 15, 2025
item.description:
This week’s roundup is bursting with forward-looking insights—from NVIDIA’s new AgentIQ library to Google’s Agent2Agent protocol, both pushing the boundaries of multi-agent collaboration. We dig into what the Model Context Protocol (MCP) really abstracts and explore the evolving role of LLMs in autonomous agents.

Speaking of MCP, we celebrate a big win for .NET devs with Microsoft’s new C# SDK. Plus, we get a glimpse of AI in 2027 and ride the rhythm of vibe coding with GitHub Copilot. Let’s dive in!

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 14, 2025
item.description:
This week’s AI reading list had everything from creative game development powered by vibe coding to deep dives into AI agents and the new Model Context Protocol (MCP). I explore the tools and ideas shaping the next wave of intelligent, collaborative systems.

Oh, and speaking of agents – the Call for Speakers is now open for our next event: Data & AI Community Day Durban: Season of AI – The Age of Agency. If you’re into AI Agents, Generative AI, or just want to vibe with the community, this one’s for you.

item.title: Interesting Stuff - Week 13, 2025
item.description:
This week was all about agents—multi-agent simulations, image-generating copilots, and the unstoppable rise of the Model Context Protocol (MCP). From Unreal Engine-powered MARL platforms to real-time AI agents streaming fresh data via Confluent, the pace of innovation is wild.

MCP continues to dominate the conversation, and I’ve gathered the best reads to help make sense of it all. Plus, a quick recap of our recent AI @ Ignite++ event and a sneak peek at what’s next!
